title: Introduction to R
description: A three-day free virtual workshop for beginners in R.
contents:
Sometimes in August, I had a conversation with the founder of the Pacesetter Leadership Club on organizing a free 10-hour virtual introductory workshop for beginners in R, especially those in the healthcare industry. The workshop held online between 11th and 13th October 2021. We had over 500 persons registered with over 150 attendees across 3 continents. During the workshop, we discussed:
Intro to R
Importing data
Data cleaning
Data transformation
Data visualization
Data communication

title: Using R for healthcare improvement
description: R-Ladies Abuja virtual meetup session. I discussed some of the ways that I use R to improve public health programs.
contents:
Poster R-Ladies Abuja meetupI was invited by the organizers of R-Ladies Abuja to share my thoughts how I utilize R software within the healthcare industry. I discussed the power of R in designing interactive dashboards and the usefulness, especially during the peak of the pandemic. I also talked about how I use R scripts to automate analysis and how over time, I have organized the scripts into an R package - {tidyndr}.

title: Introduction to biostatistics
description: Slide presentation designed using slidify embeded with {learnr} tutorials for Introduction to Biostatistics.
contents:
One of my early free training sessions in data analytics. The audience at the time were healthcare workers (mostly resident physicians) but the slides were simplified enough to capture any young learner with basic knowledge of biological sciences.
The slides were designed in R with interactive practice questions. I hope others can find them useful too.
